properties.areaDesc: Los Angeles County San Fernando Valley
properties.headline: Freeze Watch issued February 2 at 1:13PM PST until February 5 at 9:00AM PST by NWS Los Angeles/Oxnard CA
properties.description:
* WHAT...For the High Wind Warning, north winds 25 to 40 mph with
gusts up to 60 mph, strongest northern portions. For the Freeze
Watches, sub- freezing temperatures in the upper 20s to lower
30s, mainly from Westlake Village to Woodland Hills.

* WHERE...San Fernando Valley.

* WHEN...For the High Wind Warning, from 8 PM this evening to
noon PST Monday. For the first Freeze Watch, from late Monday
night through Tuesday morning. For the second Freeze Watch,
from late Tuesday night through Wednesday morning.

* IMPACTS...Damaging winds will blow down large objects such as
trees and power lines. Power outages are likely. Travel will be
difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. Frost and
freeze conditions could kill crops, other sensitive vegetation
and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Strongest winds tonight across northern
portions of the valley. Major roadways the could be impacted by
the strong winds included highway 118 and interstates 5 and 405.
properties.instruction:
People should avoid being outside in and around trees and
branches. If possible, remain in the lower levels of your home
during the windstorm, and avoid windows. Use caution if you must
drive.

Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. Plan for
extra time to defrost vehicle windshields.

NWSheadline: HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 8 PM THIS EVENING TO NOON PST MONDAY... ...FREEZE WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... ...FREEZE WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING
